intro: Erophila brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited erophila, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
